dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNO MacGUFF stands on a placid street in a nondescript  subdivision, facing the curb. It's FALL. Juno is sixteen  years old, an artfully bedraggled burnout kid. She winces and shields her eyes from the glare of the sun. The objec of her rapt attention is a battered living room set, aban curbside by its former owners. There is a fetid-looking  leather recliner, a chrome-edged coffee table, and a tast latchhooked rug featuring a roaring tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started with a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK - Juno approaches a boy hidden by shadow. He's  sitting in an overstuffed chair. She slowly, clumsily low herself onto his lap. A 60's Brazilian track plays from a vintage record player

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how long I've wanted  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOG barks, jarring Juno back to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, Banana. Hey, shut your gob  for a second, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a teacup poodle tethered in the yard a few feet aw from the abandoned living room set. The dog yaps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most magnificent discarded  living room set I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swigs from an absurdly oversized carton of juice and  wipes her mouth with the back of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN ANIMATED TITLE SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Juno marching down various street, pumping her arms like jogger and chugging intermittently from the huge carton o juice. We watch her breathlessly navigate suburbia, clear on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a panting Juno arrives at DANCING ELK DRUG on th main drag of her small Minnesota suburb, Dancing Elk. The automatic doors of the store part to reveal Juno's fl serious face. She carelessly flings the empty juice conta over her shoulder and onto the curb. A group of DROPOUTS  with skateboards near the entrance glare at her. She enters the DRUGSTORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROLLO, the eccentric drugstore clerk, sneers at Juno from behind the counter. He wears a polyester uniform vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well. If it isn't MacGuff the  Crime Dog! Back for another test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the last one was defective.  The plus sign looked more like a  division sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rollo regards her with intense skepticism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remain unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rollo pulls the bathroom key out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your third test today, Mama  Bear. Your eggo is preggo, no doubt  about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eavesdropping TOUGH GIRL wearing an oversized jacket a lots of makeup gapes at Juno from the beauty aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three times? Oh girl, you are way  pregnant. It's easy to tell. Is your  nipples real brown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pile of stolen COSMETICS falls out of the girl's jacket and clatters to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno crosses and crosses her legs awkwardly, hopping. It' obvious she has to use the bathroom urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're having twins. Maybe  your little boyfriend's got mutant  sperms and he knocked you up twice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silencio! I just drank my weight in  Sunny D. and I have to go, pronto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rollo sighs and slips her the bathroom key. Juno races do one of the aisles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know where the lavatory  is. (calling after her) You pay for that pee stick when you're  done! Don't think it's yours just  because you've marked it with your  urine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I didn't say it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not. You're not a lion in  a pride! (to himself) These kids, acting like lions with  their unplanned pregnancies and their  Sunny Delights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim, reeking public bathroom, Juno hovers over the commode with her boxer shorts around her ankles. She clum tries to use the pregnancy test. We see the test box sitting on the sink. It's a TeenWave  Discount Pregnancy Test. The accompanying outdated packag photo is of a shrugging 80s teen with a resigned expressi The fine print on the box reads "From the makers of Sun-G Lightening Hair Spritz!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno holds the developing test in her hand and slaps the  open test box on the front counter. Rollo scans it and ba it indifferently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and this too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places a giant licorice Super Rope on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the prognosis, Fertile  Myrtle? Minus or plus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining stick) I don't know. It's not... seasoned  yet. Wait. Huh. Yeah, there's that  pink plus sign again. God, it's  unholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes the stick desperately in an attempt to skew th results. Shake. Shake. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't no Etch-a-Sketch. This is  one doodle that can't be undid,  homeskillet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno walks slowly and dejectedly up the street to her hou gnawing on the Super Rope. She stops and loops the Super  Rope over a low-hanging tree branch, contemplating how to fashion a noose. Juno trudges toward her HOUSE. The yard is a wild tangle prairie grass and wild flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno's BEDROOM is decorated with punk posters: The Damned The Germs, the Stooges, Television, Richard Hell, etc. Sh picks up a hamburger-shaped phone to call her best friend LEAH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEAH's room is cluttered with the sentimental junk that  certain girls love to hoard. The PHONE rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering phone) Yo-yo-yiggity-yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a suicide risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Juno?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's Morgan Freeman. Got any bones  that need collecting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the one in my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in low tones) Dude, I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just a food baby. Did you  have a big lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a food baby. I took three  pregnancy tests today. I am definitely  up the spout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you even generate enough pee  for three pregnancy tests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drank like ten tons of Sunny  Delight. Anyway, yeah. I'm pregnant.  And you're shockingly cavalier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this for real? Like for real, for  real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Oh shit! Phuket Thailand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the kind of emotion I was  looking for in the first take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you going to go to  Havenbrooke or Women Now for the  abortion? You need a note from your  parents for Havenbrooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Women Now, I guess. The  commercial says they help women now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to call for you? I called  for Becky last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, I'll call them myself. But I do  need your help with something very  urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah and Juno struggle to drag a recliner across a well  manicured suburban lawn. They make a formidable team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy lifting can only help you at  this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is sick, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah busts a gut laughing. It's a stunningly accurate  portrayal of Bleeker's parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you were bored? Is that how this  blessed miracle came to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, it was a premeditated act. The  sex, I mean, not getting pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you decide you were going  to do Bleeker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, a year ago, in Spanish class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker and Juno are sitting at their desks, listening to teacher lecturing about spanish. Bleeker discreetly pushe POSTCARD to Juno with his foot. She picks it up off the f reads it, then looks at Bleeker, who is watching the teac obediently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha! You love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's extremely complicated, and I'd  rather not talk about it in my fragile  state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hefts a coffee table with her bare hands. She's weari her father's LIFTING BELT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what was it like humping Bleeker's  bony bod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was magnificent, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Bleeker putting on double socks in his Car-Bed. CU of Bleeker putting on his sweat bands. CU of Bleeker applying Runner's Glide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of a CROISSANT POCKET warming in the microwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL BLEEKER steps onto the front porch of his house for  early morning track practice. He wears a cross country un that reads "DANCING ELK CONDORS." He is eating some kind microwaved snack gimmick. Bleeker is startled to discover that Juno is outside wait for him. She has somehow arranged the living room set on front lawn, and is seated in the armchair, chewing a pipe officiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bleek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cool tiger. Looks proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I swiped it from Ms. Rancick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shorts are looking especially  gold today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom uses color-safe bleach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Carole. (a beat) So, guess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned silence. Juno pops up the footrest of the recline and leans back comfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. (fidgeting) What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dancing Elk Prep cross country team runs past Bleeker house in a thundering herd, wearing a motley assortment o warm-ups. Their momentum stirs the crackling fall leaves. They wave and holler at Bleeker and Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I see them all running like  that, with their things bouncing  around in their shorts, I always  picture them naked, even if I don't  want to. I have intrusive thoughts  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to be running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you think we should do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might, you know, nip it  in the bud before it gets worse.  Because I heard in health class that  pregnancy often results in an infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, typically. That's what happens  when our moms and teachers get  pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's cool with you, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wizard, I guess. I mean do  what you think is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real sorry I had sex with you. I  know it wasn't your idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose idea was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you at school, O.K.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mounts her bicycle and waves before riding off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to nobody in  particular) Whose idea was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno pushes her crappy bike into the bike rack and winds lock around it. In the background, a group of 3 NERDS pla live-action RPG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not! You don't have the armor.  That Orc Armor you bought from the  wizard doesn't have the power level  to parry my hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno tries to push through the masses, but the throng of  students is thick and unwielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno rummages through her locker, which is plastered with photos of Leah and Bleeker, plus a giant poster of Iggy P in his heyday. She grabs a dilapidated physics textbook. A few pages sli out. STEVE RENDAZO (the same asshole who harassed her as walked to the drugstore) passes by in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, your book fell apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have looked at your face.  PWAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He high-fives his klatch of buddies and moves along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funny thing is that Steve Rendazo  secretly wants me. Jocks like him  always want freaky girls. Girls with  horn-rimmed glasses and vegan footwear  and Goth makeup. Girls who play the  cello and wear Converse All-Stars  and want to be children's librarians  when they grow up. Oh yeah, jocks  eat that shit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Steve looking back at Juno for a brief second with mixed feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just won't admit it, because  they're supposed to be into perfect  cheerleaders like Leah. Who,  incidentally, is into teachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Leah at the far end of the hallway, talking animat with a paunchy middle-aged teacher, KEITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from a distance) Me too! I love Woody Allen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS bustle in, as the teacher, MR. TINKER tries to  maintain order. Juno heads toward her desk and sets down bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People! We're doing our photomagnetism  lab today, so find your partner and  break out into fours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno looks up and meets eyes with her longtime lab partne Bleeker. Sound the gong of awkwardness! Juno and Bleeker head separately over to an available lab station and unpack their bags in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! Nothing like experimenting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did the prep questions for this  lab last night. You can copy my  answers if you need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides a piece of graph paper in front of Juno without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I couldn't copy your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you copy my work every week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I'm kind of a deadbeat lab  partner, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind. You definitely bring  something to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charisma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other two LAB PARTNERS, a humorless couple, join them the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, who's ready for some  photomagnificence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a menstrual migraine, and I  can't look at bright lights today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda, I told you to go to the  infirmary and lie down. You never  listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Josh, I don't take orders. Not  from you and not from any man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you've been acting like  this ever since I went up to see my  brother at Mankato. I told you,  nothing happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened. Because your  eyes? Are very cold? They're very  cold, Josh. They're cold, lying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? My eyes are not lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes they are, Josh. Since Mankato,  they have been lying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Bleeker observe the argument like tennis spectat fascinated by the dynamics of a real couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm going to set up the  apparatus. Juno, want to get a C  clamp out of that drawer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Call me when you're OFF the  rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Call me when you learn how to  love just one person and not cheat  at your brother's college just because  you had four Smirnoff Ices and a  bottle of Snow Peak Peach flavored  Boone's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I'll be sure to do that, Amanda.  I'll make a note of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He furiously scrawls a fake memo in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow Peak Peach is the best flavor  of Boone's. Right, Bleek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker reddens and continues constructing the apparatus. GIRL LAB PARTNER stalks off dramatically. Bleeker shakes his head and rifles through his textbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno examines a large ad in the newspaper that depicts a  distraught TEEN GIRL clutching her head in a moment of st conflict. The ad reads: "Pregnant? Find the clinic that g women choice. Women's Choice Health Center." Juno picks up her hamburger phone and dials. For a moment she attempts to copy the melodramatic pose from the ad,  checking herself out in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking along with  voice prompt) "Para instruciones en Espanol, oprima  numero dos."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses a few buttons in succession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, I need to procure a hasty  abortion?... What was that? I'm sorry,  I'm on my hamburger phone and it's  kind of awkward to talk on. It's  really more of a novelty than a  functional appliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SMACKS the phone a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better? Okay, good. Yeah, as I said,  I need an abortion, two... sixteen...  Um, it was approximately two months  and four days ago that I had the  sex. That's a guestimate. Okay, next  Saturday? Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it when adults use the term  "sexually active."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HEALTH TEACHER in slo-mo puts a condom on a banana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that even mean? Can I  deactivate someday, or is this a  permanent state of being? I guess  Bleeker went live that night we did  it. I guess he hadn't done it before,  and that's why he got that look on  his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FLASHBACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering: he comically wide-eyed with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno, her father MAC, her stepmother BREN, and LIBERTY BE sit at a very typical kitchen table, eating dinner. MAC  shovels food while chatting about his day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen this octopus  furnace. I had to get out my Hazmat  suit just to get up in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad used to be in the Army, but  now he's just your average HVAC  specialist. He and my mom got divorced  when I was five. She lives on a Havasu  reservation in Arizona...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with her new husband and three  replacement kids. Oh, and she  inexplicably mails me a cactus every  Valentine's Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILE OF NEGLECTED CACTI festering in a corner of Juno's r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm like, "Thanks a heap, Coyote  Ugly. This cactus-gram stings even  worse than your abandonment."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREN is cutting up LIBERTY'S food diligently. Her nails a brilliant, holding the silverware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my stepmom, Bren...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's obsessed with dogs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren's nail salon in all its glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...owns a nail salon called Bren's  Tens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren chats up a customer as she applies a fresh coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and she always smells like  methylmethacrylate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberty Bell coughs pitifully as Bren leans over her plat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Juno, how did your maneuver go  last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which maneuver, sir? The one in which  I moved an entire living room set  from one lawn to another, or the one  in which I cleared a sixty-four ounce  blue slushie in ten minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren speaks in her strong city accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno? Did you happen to barf in my  urn? Mac, you know that nice urn by  the front door, the one I got up in  Stillwater? I found some weird blue  shit, I mean stuff, gunk, in there  this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never barf in your urn,  Brenda. Maybe L.B. did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Liberty Bell blithely pouring bacon bits onto her  dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liberty Bell, if I see one more Baco  on that potato, I'm gonna kick your  monkey ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic. The is a lone ABORTION PROTESTER, a teenager of Asian descent holding a hugely oversized sign that reads "NO BABIES LIK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting in extremely  shy, accented voice) All babies want to get borned! All  babies want to get borned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno recognizes the PROTESTER as a classmate of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hi Su-Chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi Juno. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm good. (pause) Did you finish that paper for Worth's  class yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet. I tried to work on it a  little last night, but I'm having  trouble concentrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try Adderall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I'm off pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wise move. I know this girl who had  a huge crazy freakout because she  took too many behavioral meds at  once. She took off her clothes and  jumped into the fountain at Ridgedale  Mall and she was like, "Blaaaaah!  I'm a kraken from the sea!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues on toward the clinic entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Juno! Your baby probably has a beating  heart, you know. It can feel pain.  And it has fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Fingernails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers the concept, then pushes open the clinic do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist sits behind a pane of bulletproof glass. The waiting room is semi-crowded, occupied mostly by preg women, teens and ill-behaved children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Women's Choice, where  women are trusted friends. Please  put your hands where I can see them  and surrender any bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno flashes her best jazz hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm here for the big show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno MacGuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist raises a pierced eyebrow and arranges so paperwork on a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks I'm using a fake name.  Like Gene Simmons or Mother Teresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist hands Juno the clipboard and a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to fill these out, both  sides. And don't skip the hairy  details. We need to know about every  score and every sore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist reaches into one of those ubiquitous wom clinic CONDOM JARS, and holds up a fistful of purple rubb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some free condoms?  They're boysenberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. I'm off sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My partner uses these every time we  have intercourse. They make his balls  smell like pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a seat in the WAITING ROOM and rifles through a pile of old magazines. The magazine selection is lots of  "mommy mags" and health related periodicals. She selects issue of Family Digest and gingerly flips through for a f moments. Then she looks over and notices the FINGERNAILS of a near teen, who looks as nervous as she does. The girl bites he thumbnail and spits it onto the floor. Juno looks away, but immediately notices another waiting  woman, who absently scratches her arm with long fake nail Suddenly, she sees fingernails EVERYWHERE. The receptioni clicks her nails on the front desk. Another woman blows o her fresh manicure. Everyone seems to be fidgeting with t fingers somehow. Juno suddenly looks terror-stricken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss MacGoof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer. We see that Juno's chair is EMPTY. The receptionist cranes her neck and sees the front door  drift shut. Juno's figure recedes into the distance as sh tears off down the street, running as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah's front door swings open to reveal a breathless Juno standing sheepishly on the porch. Leah sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, dumbass? I  thought I was supposed to pick you  up at four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't do it, Leah! It smelled  like a dentist in there. They had  these really horrible magazines,  with, like, spritz cookie recipes  and bad fiction and water stains,  like someone read them in the tub.  And the receptionist tried to give  me these weird condoms that looked  like grape suckers, and she told me  about her boyfriend's pie balls, and  Su-Chin Kuah was there, and she told  me the baby had fingernails.  Fingernails!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gruesome. I wonder if the baby's  claws could scratch your vag on the  way out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying pregnant, Le.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down dude, my mom's  around here somewhere. She doesn't  know we're sexually active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that even mean? Anyway, I  got to thinking on the way over. I  was thinking maybe I could give the  baby to somebody who actually likes  that kind of thing. You know, like a  woman with a bum ovary or something.  Or some nice lesbos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you'll get huge. Your chest  is going to milktate. And you have  to tell everyone you're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Maybe they'll canonize me  for being so selfless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they'll totally shit and be  super mad at you and not let you  graduate or go to Cabo San Lucas for  spring break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker and I were going to go to  Gettysburg for spring break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah sighs, as if there's no helping her nerdy friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you could look at one of  those adoption ads. I see them all  the time in the Penny Saver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are ads? For parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! "Desperately Seeking Spawn."  They're right by the ads for like,  iguanas and terriers and used fitness  equipment. It's totally legit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Leah. I can't scope out  wannabe parents in the Penny Saver!  That's tacky. That's like buying  clothes at the Pump n' Munch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Leah are sitting at a bench in a park. They slur giant blue slushies and sift through a pile of Penny Save Juno has her pipe with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Penny Saver sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it sucks for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the pages in silence for a moment. Their lips a teeth are Windex-blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this one "Wholesome,  spiritually wealthy couple have found  true love with each other." (checks to see that  Juno is paying  attention) "All that's missing is your bastard."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading a different  page) There's a guy in here who's giving  away a piano. Free for the hauling!  We should put it in Bleeker's yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I heard you. I just can't give  the baby to people who describe  themselves as "wholesome." I'm looking  for something a little edgier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you have in mind, a family  of disturbed loners who are into  gunplay and incest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking a graphic designer,  mid-thirties, and his cool Asian  wife who dresses awesome and plays  bass. But I'm trying to not be too  particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, how about this one?  "Healthy, educated couple seeking  infant to join our family of five.  You will be compensated. Help us  complete the circle of love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeesh, they sound like a cult.  Besides, they're greedy bitches.  They already have three kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Juno. Juno! Look at this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the paper and motions for Juno to look. Jun scans the ad silently. We see the ad. It contains a photo of an attractive coupl with ambiguous Mona Lisa smiles. It reads "Educated,  successful couple wishes to..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were Mark and Vanessa Loring,  and they were beautiful even in black  and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Paulie's bedroom window -- festooned with childish curtains -- and the light on inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker lies on his Car-bed in his track uniform, listeni to the same LP from when he and Juno went all the way. He stares between the pages of his embossed Dancing Elk P yearbook. We see the object of his gaze is Juno's black and white  YEARBOOK PHOTO. Next to it, we see a sloppy, handwritten  message from Juno. We hear Juno's voice reading the messa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bleeker! Spank off to this with  motion lotion. Just kidding (kind  of.) Your best friend, Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker picks up the phone. It's the same HAMBURGER PHONE Juno has. He reconsiders and puts it down. There's a knock on the bedroom door. BLEEKER'S MOM pokes her dowdy head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul? Are you coming downstairs to  eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ran eight miles today, Puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry, oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's breakfast for supper. Your  favorite, Paulie. I made French toast  and sausage. Patties, not linkies,  just like you like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker places his hand silently on his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno MacGuff called while you were  out running. She wants to know if  you're coming to her little  coffeehouse performance on Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've mentioned it about fifty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope you don't consider her a  close friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker's mom gives up and closes the door. We see that Bleeker is clutching a pair of PANTIES in one hand, which he slowly releases as the 45 ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren and MAC are seated on the couch. Leah is standing ne for reinforcements. Juno paces nervously, trying to suss how to break the massive news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea how to spit this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon, did you get expelled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The school would probably contact  you in the event of my expulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was just asking. It seemed  plausible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a large sum of money?  Legal counsel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I'm definitely not asking  for anything. Except maybe mercy.  Like, it would be really great if  nobody hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done, Junebug? Did you  hit someone with the Previa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best to just tell them, man. Rip off  the Band-Aid and let it bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren and Mac are predictably speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm going to give it up for  adoption. I already found the perfect  people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say they're going to pay my  medical expenses and everything. I  promise this will all be resolved in  thirty-odd weeks, and we can pretend  it never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, you guys. If it's any  consolation, I have heartburn that's  like, radiating down to my kneecaps  and I haven't gone number two since  Wednesday. Morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I didn't even know you were sexually  active!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno cringes upon hearing her most-hated term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby? I don't know anything about  it yet. I only know it's got  fingernails, allegedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nails? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean the father! Who's the  father, Juno?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's, well, it's Paulie Bleeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren and Mac burst into shocked laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie Bleeker? I didn't know he had  it in him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) He just doesn't look, well, virile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is no laughing matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant) No, it's not. Paulie is virile, by  the way. He was very good in... chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah fires a be quiet glance at Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say you were thinking about  adoption?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, there's this couple who've  been trying to have a baby for five  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found them in the Penny Saver by  the exotic birds section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren looks understandably alarmed. Juno hastily attempts make the situation sound more legitimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they have a real lawyer and  everything. I'm going to meet with  them next weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junebug, that is a tough, tough thing  to do. Probably tougher than you can  understand right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not ready to be a mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn skippy, you're not! You don't  even remember to give Liberty Bell  her breathing meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once! And she didn't die, if you  recall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, had you considered, you know,  the alternative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah and Juno exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a brave young lady.  You're made of stronger stuff than I  thought. You're a little Viking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first, we have to get  you healthy. You need prenatal  vitamins. Incidentally, they'll do  incredible things for your nails, so  that's a plus. Oh, and we need to  schedule a doctor's appointment.  Find out where you're going to  deliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The term "deliver" is so weird. Can  we not say "deliver"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does "crap it out" sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno, I want to come with you to  meet these adoption people. You're  just a kid. I don't want you to get  ripped off by a couple of babystarved  wingnuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac nods, satisfied, then contemplates the situation dism

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were the kind of girl  who knew when to say when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what kind of girl I  am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing tension) Why don't you girls go upstairs for  a while? I think Mac's gonna blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Leah hightail it upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell it to me straight, Bren.  Do you think this is my fault? Her  mother's fault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think kids get bored and have  intercourse. And I think Junebug was  a dummy about it. But we have to  move on from here and help her figure  it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to be a Pop-Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to be a Pop-Pop.  And Juno's not going to be a ma.  Somebody else is going to find a  precious blessing from Jesus in this  garbage dump of a situation. I  friggin' hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conspiratorially) Did you see it coming when she sat  us down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God yeah. But I was hoping she  was expelled or into hard drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my first instinct too. Or  D.W.I. Anything but this. And I'm  going to punch that Bleeker kid in  the weiner the next time I see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Mac, no! He's a sweet kid. You  know it wasn't his idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac shrugs in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays as we see SPARSE IMAGES OF VANESSA LORING'S H preparing the house for Juno's arrival -- Sprucing a vase of FLOWERS. Straightening a FRAMED PHOTO of the Lorings. Dusting off a table with one of those WETNAPS for furnitu Lining up a shelf of BOOKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Previa cruises slowly into the Loring's fancy gated  community. Mac pulls over and parks on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Vanessa Loring have an impressive, though generi McMansion. The entire yard is unlandscaped soil. Mac pres the doorbell while Juno chews her nails uncomfortably. Bo look mortified as they wait for someone to greet them. VANESSA opens the door. She's a pretty, meticulous woman her early thirties. Very Banana Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! I'm Vanessa. You must be Juno  and Mr. MacGuff. I'm Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Thank you for having me and  my irresponsible child over to your  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Thank you. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa awkwardly leads them into her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take your coats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her hooded sweatshirt and thrusts it into  Vanessa's arms who sets it on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wicked pic in the Penny Saver, by  the way. Super classy. Not like those  other people with the fake woods in  the background. Like I'm really going  to fall for that, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found us in the Penny Saver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK LORING appears next to Vanessa. He's a boyishly  attractive guy in his mid-thirties. He glances sheepishly at Vanessa upon hearing the Penny S mention, then extends his hand to Mac and Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Mark Loring. I'm the husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Vanessa usher Juno and Mac into the austere, spa living room. A woman in a business suit sits on the couch with a briefcase in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our attorney, Gerta Rauss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in exaggerated,  growling German accent) Geeeerta Rauuuss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straight) Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac seizes Mark's hand and pumps it heartily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mac MacGuff, and this, of course,  is my daughter Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the city in Alaska?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Well, let's sit down and get  to know each other a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get drinks. What would everyone  like? I've got Pellegrino, Vitamin  Water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Maker's Mark, please. Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's joking. Junebug has a wonderful  sense of humor, which is just one of  her many genetic gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also have good teeth. No cavities.  We finally got fluoridated water in  Dancing Elk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bares them frighteningly to demonstrate. Vanessa stares, unflappable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac and Juno join Mark and Gerta Rauss on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Juno. First off, how far along  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean in your pregnancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh, my stepmom took me to the  doctor yesterday and they said I was  twelve weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa enters with the refreshments on a tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's marvelous. So you're almost  into your second trimester, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, apparently. I'm having it on  May 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tough part's almost over for  you. I mean, my girlfriends always  tell me the first couple months are  the hardest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I hardly noticed it. I'm  more worried about the part where I  have to start wearing jeans with an  elastic panel in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think pregnancy is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're lucky it's not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa's looks to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing throat) So, let's discuss how we're gonna do  this... thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just have the baby and give  it to you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Vanessa are willing to  negotiate an open adoption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protective) Wait. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means they'd send annual updates,  photos, let Juno know how the baby  is doing as he or she grows up. Of  course, Juno's legal rights would be  terminated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah. I don't want to see pictures.  I don't need to be notified of  anything. Can't we just kick it old  school? I could just put the baby in  a basket and send it your way. You  know, like Moses in the reeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, that would be kickin'  it Old Testament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Juno lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah! The way people used to  do it. Quick and dirty, like ripping  off a Band-Aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then we agree a traditional  closed adoption would be best for  all involved, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, yeah. Close it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa is clearly ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, we'll compensate you for  your medical expenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you looking for any other  compensation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no... I'm not going to sell  the baby. I just want it to grow up  with people who are ready to love it  and be parents. I'm in high school,  dude. I'm ill-equipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing an amazing and selfless  thing for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa has wanted a baby since we  got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be a mommy so badly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Mac stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, haven't you ever felt like you  were born to do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Heating and air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was born to be a mother.  Some of us are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, are you looking forward to  being a dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, why not? I mean, every guy  wants to be a father. Coach soccer,  help with science projects and... I  don't know. Fatherly stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac casts a subtle, dubious glance at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shall we start looking over  the paperwork? Gerta has already  drafted some preliminary documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use the facilities first? Being  pregnant makes you pee like  Seabiscuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. The powder room down here is  being re-tiled, but you can use the  master bath upstairs. Go up, then  turn left and on your right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room with a toilet, got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno heads into the foyer and up the stairs. We see a pos photo of Mark and Vanessa in the stairwell. Their house i beautiful, but frigid. Juno rubs her arms, shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loring's bathroom is huge. Juno flushes and goes to t double sink to wash her hands. She opens the overhead cab and sees Vanessa's toiletries. She spritzes on some perfu and examines the more expensive grooming items. There's a crinkled tube of LUBE in the cabinet. Juno picks it up,  fascinated. She rubs a drop of it between her hands and r it through her hair like pomade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno opens the bathroom door and instantly BUMPS into Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops! Yikes, I didn't expect to  see you up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was just getting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your wife send you up here to  spy on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! Do we come off like paranoid  yuppies or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don't just invite a random  pregnant teenager into your house  and leave her unsupervised. I could  be a total klepto, for all you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get a klepto vibe from you.  Evil genius? Maybe. Arsonist? Wouldn't  rule it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did steal a squirt of perfume.  What do you think? It's Clinique  Happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her WRIST up to Mark's twitching nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell those sparkling topnotes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark inhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to feel happy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be happy, Holmes. I'm  giving you and Vanessa the gift of  life. Sweet, screaming, pooping life!  And you don't even have to be there  when the baby comes out of me all  covered in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viscera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood and guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better get back downstairs ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno mocks his use of "ASAP" silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (halting) Wait a minute. Is that a Les Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno is staring into a room with the door slightly ajar. see GUITARS mounted on the wall, and the edges of posters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's, uh, my room. Vanessa  lets me have a room for all my old  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you get a whole room in your  own house? She's got you on a long  leash there, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are plastered with FRAMED POSTERS of early-90s rock bands. (Mudhoney, Jane's Addiction etc.) Mark remove his LES PAUL from its moorings and hands it to Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. I've always liked  Gibson better than Fender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rock a Harmony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back a chuckle) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm a pawn shop rocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I swear I'm not a gear snob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno turns the guitar over, examining it closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, Mahogany? What happens  if you crack the neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I used to play in  a really tight band back when I lived  in Chicago, and one night we opened  for the Melvins... do you know who  the Melvins are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we were playing with them and  I busted this guitar onstage. It  cost me $800 and a dime bag just to  have it fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was this, like '96?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '93. I'm telling you that was the  best time for rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh, 1977! Punk Volume 1. You  weren't there, so you can't understand  the magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't even alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa, Mac and Gerta Rauss are waiting in awkward silen for Juno and Mark to return. Mac notices a brand new PILA MACHINE sitting in its packaging in a corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What's that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pilates machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't make anything. It's for  exercising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Juno tool around on the guitars unplugged. They  play little riffs. He teaches her a couple chords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife just ordered one of those  Tony Little Gazelles off the TV, you  know, from the guy with the ponytail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa and Gerta have no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy just doesn't look right to  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a shriek of AMP FEEDBACK, followed by loud,  discordant GUITAR STRUMMING can be heard drifting down fr upstairs. Vanessa's looks to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her guests) Will you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark has strapped on the Les Paul and is playing and sing "Doll Parts" by Hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly singing  together) "Yeah, they really want you... they  really want you... they really do."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Building together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing together and  connecting) Yeah, they really want you... they  really want you... and I do to. (both blush)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANESSA appears in the doorway. Juno immediately puts dow the guitar. Mark doesn't notice her immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passionate singing) I WANT TO BE THE... (notices Vanessa) Oh, sorry honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark clumsily puts down the guitar and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are playing music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno just wanted a closer look at  Kimber here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guitar is named Kimber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. My axe is named  Roosevelt. After Franklin, not Ted.  Franklin was the hot one with the  polio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Gerta is waiting for us  downstairs with some important stuff  for us to go over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark hangs the guitars back on the wall. He and Juno exit the room, chastised. Vanessa looks to Mark in question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to interrupt the jam  sessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Mac have put their coats on and are in the proce of leaving. Gerta hands Juno the DOCUMENTS. Vanessa and M trail behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, look those over and give me a  call at my office if you have any  questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno, we'd really appreciate it if  you could keep us updated on any  doctor's appointments, ultrasounds,  other things of that nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sure. Of course you'd want to  know how your kid is cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, then, you really think you're  going to go ahead with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac STARES at Juno gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. For sure. I like you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno looks at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How sure? Percentage-wise, would you  say you're 80% sure, 90% sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark seems visibly embarrassed by Vanessa's manic demeano

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to say I'm 104% sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if I could give it to you now,  I would. But it probably looks like  a Sea Monkey at this point, so I  think we should leave it in there  for a while until it gets cuter, you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, right? Stellar news.  Well, you guys drive safe, and we'll  hear from you soon, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, take care of yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Mac exit. Mark shuts the door. All is silent in foyer. Mark, Vanessa and Gerta stand motionless. Gerta pu her fist triumphantly, trying to create a mood of celebra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly aggressive) All RIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa buries her head in her hands and weeps hoarsely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now WINTER. The TRACK TEAM jogs in formation, leavi tracks in the snow. Those bastards never stop running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker is running alone on the track. His exhalations ar icy puffs in the air. Bleeker's friend VIJAY jogs up alon him. Vijay is a solemn, skinny boy, much like Bleeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Vijay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear Juno MacGuff is pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like our moms and teachers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear it's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a trip, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know anything about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should grow a moustache. You're  a real man now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't grow a moustache. It never  comes in evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. But I'm going to stop  wearing underpants in order to raise  my sperm count. See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIJAY jogs off. Bleeker STOPS and wipes away his sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking over Juno's now FIVE MONTH PREGNANT BELLY t school administrator filling out a slip. Juno takes the slip, turns around and smiles all the way  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno exits the head office and bumps into Bleeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Juno... A couple of us are going  to the cineplex after school to donut  that movie with the guy with eighteen  kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Bleek... Going for my  ultrasound. Gotta note and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to drop by later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLOOGE! We see ultrasound goo being squirted onto Juno's exposed pregnant belly. An ULTRASOUND TECHNICIAN is using Doppler device to view the contents of her burgeoning bum Bren and Leah ooh and ahh at the resulting image. The tech takes measurements and types them into her datab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor reveals the baby's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (various) Check that out... No way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily) Would you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out Baby Big-Head. That kid is  scary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a sacred vessel. All you've  got in your belly is Taco Bell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gazing at the monitor) It is really weird looking. It's  like it's not even real. I can't  believe there are saps who actually  cry at these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Leah look at BREN, who is dabbing her eyes  discreetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not made of stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there we have it. Would you  like to know the sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, please Junebug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. No, I definitely don't want  to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planning to be surprised when you  deliver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Mark and Vanessa to be  surprised, and if I know, I won't be  able to keep myself from telling  them and ruining the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescending) Are Mark and Vanessa your friends at  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're the people who are  adopting the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, thank goodness for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just see a lot of teenage mothers  come through here. It's obviously a  poisonous environment for a baby to  be raised in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno, Leah and Bren become immediately defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know I'm so poisonous?  Like, what if the adoptive parents  turn out to be evil molesters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or stage parents!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could be utterly negligent.  Maybe they'll do a far shittier job  of raising a kid than my dumbass  stepdaughter ever would. Have you  considered that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your job title, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, what-is-your-job-title, Missy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an ultrasound technician, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm a nail technician, and I  think we both ought to stick to what  we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're special because you  get to play Picture Pages up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren gestures to the ULTRASOUND MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My five year-old daughter could do  that, and let me tell you, she is  not the brightest bulb in the tanning  bed. So why don't you go back to  night school in Manteno and learn a  real trade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ULTRASOUND TECH exits in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren, you're a dick! I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno lays in bed checking out the ULTRASOUND PRINT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Previa drives into the front gate of Mark and Vanessa exclusive community. A sign on the gate reads "Glacial  Valley."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno rings the doorbell, shifting her weight in the cold. MARK answers the door, dressed in a t-shirt and jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno? Wow, I didn't expect to see  you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something really cool to  show you guys. Is Vanessa here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's working late tonight. She's  trying to accrue some extra time off  for when, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures awkwardly to Juno's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I hear they can be kind of a  time-suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. You wanna Ginseng Cooler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What is it with you rich people  and your herb-infused juices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Something to do with  the four-packs... (adding) ...They're not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark leads Juno into the kitchen, where he pours two drin The STEREO blares in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mostly work from home. I'm a  composer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. Like Johannes Brahms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, more commercial stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commercials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen those ads for Titanium  Power men's deodorant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Titanium Power! Get more snatch by  the batch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kind of a sellout, aren't  you? What would the Melvins say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd say you came a long way out  here not knowing if anyone would be  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you're going to want to sit  down for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move into the living room, Juno sits down and mot for Mark to join her on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Park it, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits down. With great fanfare, Juno retrieves a dark glossy sheet from the envelope. It's her ULTRASOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold, good sir! The very first  photo of your future child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark EXAMINES the ultrasound, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it kind of looks like my  friend, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) Oh, is he bald and amorphous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's the dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks jolted, as if it's the first time he considere that her baby might have a father. He stands up and holds the photo up to the light critically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell if it's a boy or a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor can tell, but I decided  not to know. I want it to be a big  surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it can really only go two ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you think. I drink tons  of booze so you might get one of  those scary neuter-babies that's  born without junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... it's parts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what junk is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We definitely want it to have junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't worry about it. My stepmom  is forcing me to eat really healthy.  She won't even let me stand in front  of the microwave or eat red M&Ms.  Hope you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new SONG has begun. Mark closes his eyes in ecstasy and walks toward the stereo. Juno follows him toward the sour of the music, looking perplexed by how happy he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only my favorite song. It's  Sonic Youth doing "Superstar" by the  Carpenters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) I've heard the Carpenters before.  Chick drummer and freaky dude. Not  unlike the White Stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't heard the Carpenters  like this. Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark grabs the STEREO REMOTE off the kitchen counter and  turns up the volume to a roar. Mark and Juno stand in sil in the kitchen. Mark mouths along with the lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lipsynching) Don't you remember you told me you  loved me, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This album is all Carpenters covers  by alt-rock bands. It's called If I  Were a Carpenter. It is God. I'll  rip a copy for you before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the least I can do. What did  you say your favorite band was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. But it's a three-way tie  between the Stooges, Patti Smith and  the Runaways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I definitely need to make you  some CDs. At least while my kid is  hanging out in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures at Juno's burgeoning paunch. Mark walks over to his music collections and starts pulli CD's. He's got a Carpenter's disc, the "No Alternative"  charity compilation, and Mother Love Bone. Juno spots a VHS TAPE on the coffee table and picks it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading title) The Wizard of Gore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Oh yeah. It's Herschel Gordon Lewis.  He's the ultimate master of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Dario Argento is the ultimate  master of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark SWIVELS AROUND slowly on his desk chair, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argento's good, but Lewis is  completely demented. We're talking  buckets of goo. Red corn syrup  everywhere. And fake brains up the  yin-yang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining the tape  box) Frankly, this looks kind of stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark gives a look - "Oh, Really?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see some particularly memorable footage from The Wizar of Gore. Mark and Juno are watching the movie and drinking root be floats. They're sitting dangerously close on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching movie) This is even better than Suspiria.  You've got decent taste in slasher  movies, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to dovetailing interests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his mug in a toast and Juno clinks it awkwardly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, have you and Vanessa thought of  a name for the baby yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sort of. Vanessa likes Madison  for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) Madison? Isn't that kind of... I  don't know, gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, pretentious much? I guess  everyone should have a mysterious  name like Juno, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad went through this phase where  he was obsessed with Greek and Roman  mythology. He named me after Zeus's  wife. I mean, Zeus had other lays,  but I'm pretty sure Juno was his  only wife. She was supposed to be  really beautiful but really mean.  Like Diana Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That suits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, not many teenage girls in  your situation would actually go  through with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I weighed my options. But after all  this, I'm glad I didn't, you know,  get rid of it. I want to have it.  For you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door suddenly slams upstairs. Vanessa's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa. Shit, you better get out of  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She just hates when I sit  around watching movies and 'not  contributing.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle this. I'm really good at  diffusing mom-type rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno jumps up and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... aww, crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa slides her BRIEFCASE off her shoulder and venture into the living room. She's struggling to carry some over shopping bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark? Are you home? I want to show  you some things I picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno intercepts her breathlessly, clutching the ULTRASOUN photo. Mark trails behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Vanessa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa JUMPS and makes a strangled sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno! God, you startled me. What are  you doing here? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to the doctor today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa is obviously entertaining some worse-case scenari Her eyes are wide and she's uncharacteristically ruffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the baby okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's the right size and  everything. I even saw its phalanges  today! Check this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the ULTRASOUND up to show Vanessa and drapes he arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the baby. Your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa drops the shopping bags, sick with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) Doesn't it look like it's waving?  It's kind of like it's saying "Hi,  Vanessa. Will you be my mommy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, it kind of does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno was nice enough to bring this  by for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came over as soon as I got that  cold ultrasound goo off my pelvis.  My stepmom verbally abused the  ultrasound tech so we were escorted  off the premises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Oh, that's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't divert her gaze from the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa chuckles tightly, clearly embarrassed by her show emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa and Mark walk Juno out. Juno peers at some shoppi bags from various kids stores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what kind of swag did you score?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mall madness, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's just some stuff I picked up.  For, you know, the baby. Babies need  a lot of things. I want everything  to be just right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought people got all that stuff  at baby showers. When my stepmom had  my sister I remember she got about a  million presents. They were all lame  though, so I wasn't jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt anyone's throwing us a shower.
