dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I think people are kind of unsure  about the situation because it's  not, you know, set in stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You mean... (aghast) Do you think I'm going to flake out  on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I don't think that, Juno.  It's just that, we went through a  situation before where it didn't  work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno glances at Mark and again at Vanessa. Vanessa looks  embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have gone to China. I  heard they give away babies like  free iPods. They shoot 'em out of  those T-shirt guns at sports events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Right. Well, Juno, your parents must  be wondering where you are. You might  want to head home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naah. I'm already pregnant, so they  figure nothing worse could happen to  me. I gotta bounce anyway. It was  nice seeing you guys again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Juno) Hey, don't forget your bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa looks pain-stricken as Mark helps Juno with her b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno kicks the snow off her shoes before she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren sits at the kitchen table with a mug of coffee and a issue of Dog Fancy. Juno enters nonchalantly, drinking a giant slushie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been, Junebug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drove to St. Cloud to show Mark  and Vanessa the ultrasound. And I  wound up staying for a couple of  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of hours? Why are you going  up there in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they wanted to know about  this stuff. They said to keep them  updated, so I did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have sent it to them. Why  would you drive an hour out to East  Jesus, Nowhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just did. And while  we were waiting for Vanessa, Mark  and I watched The Wizard of Gore and  he burned me some CDs of weird music.  He's kind of cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Bren absorbs this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake, Juno. Mark is a  married stranger. You overstepped a  boundary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Bren-duhhh, I think you're  the one overstepping boundaries.  You're acting like you're the one  who has to go through this and get  huge and push a baby out of your vag  for someone else. Besides, who cares  if he's married? I can have friends  who are married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work that way, kiddo. You  don't know squat about the dynamics  of marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren rises to leave, clutching the Dog Fancy magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the  magazine) We don't even have a dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, because you're allergic to  their saliva. I've made a lot of  sacrifices for you, Juno. And in a  couple years you're going to move  out -- and I'm getting Weimaraners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, dream big!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go fly a kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren STORMS out. Juno heads to the URN by the door and  defiantly pours the remains of her blue slushie into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno parks her PREVIA on the street. She walks up to the  house and rings the doorbell. BLEEKER'S MOM answers, visibly annoyed. Her eyes drift do to Juno's middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker's mom was possibly attractive  once. But now she looks a hobbit.  The fat one that was in The Goonies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Juno. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed Paulie's physics notes in  school today. I'm pretty sure he  needs them back, or his grade could  plummet to an A minus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steals another glance at Juno's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker's mom escorts Juno wordlessly up the stairs and d the hallway to Paulie's bedroom. Juno discreetly tries to charge ahead of her, but her expanding middle prevents he from getting past Bleeker's mom. They share an extremely  awkward moment wedged side-by-side in the narrow hallway. Bleecker's mom nudges past Juno and knocks on Bleeker's  bedroom door. The door has a cheesy racecar-themed decora hanging on it that says PAULIE'S VRROOOM! It looks like  something a 5-year old might have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie is on the floor surrounded by old quizzes, studyin like the tortured brainiac he is. Mrs. Bleeker opens the  bedroom door. Juno appears. Paulie jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't concentrate so hard, man.  I think I smell hair burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker smiles faintly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door halfway and leaves. Juno rolls her ey and pulls the door shut entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to come over. You know,  say hi. I miss hanging out with you  on school nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nervously cracks open a container of ORANGE TIC-TACS a pours them into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange Tic-Tacs are Bleeker's one  and only vice. When we made out, the  day I got pregnant, his mouth tasted  really tangy and delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker glances at Juno's midsection, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it looks like you're getting  pregnant-er these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Um, I hooked up a whole private  adoption thing. These married people  in Saint Cloud are going to be the  parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker is visibly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What are they like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy is super cool! His name is  Mark and he's into old horror movies  and he plays guitar. I actually hung  out with him today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked my dad and Bren not to narc  us out to your folks, so we should  be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's a relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno walks over to the bed and sits down next to Bleeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to really start looking  like a dork soon. Will you still  think I'm cute if I'm huge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always think you're cute. I think  you're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno is caught off guard by his sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bleek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song playing ends, and another one begins. It's "the  song," the track that Bleeker and Juno both recognize fro the infamous night in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Junebug, when all this is over  we should get the band back together  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Once Tino gets a new  drumhead we should be good to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could get back together too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were we together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker picks at the carpet, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we were once. You know, that  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Katrina De Voort? You  could go out with Katrina De Voort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like Katrina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally heard you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. Katrina smells like soup.  Her whole house smells of soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is covered in fresh snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Vanessa stand silently in the nursery. The walls are primed slate gray. A single ANTIQUE ROCKING CHAIR sit in the corner. Vanessa beams proudly and holds two paint  samples up near the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Custard or  Cheesecake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wanted to pick something  gender-neutral for now. Once we get  the baby, God willing, we can create  a more decisive palette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people think yellow is gender- neutral? I don't know one man with a  yellow bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm leaning toward Custard  in this light. I don't know. I should  paint a small area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could just wait a couple  months. It's not like the baby's  going to storm in here any second  and demand dessert-colored walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What to Expect says that readying  the baby's room is an important  process for women. It's called  "nesting."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nesting, huh? Are you planning to  build the crib out of twigs and  saliva?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should read the book. I even  flagged the "daddy chapters" for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think it's too early to paint.  That's my opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I disagree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark shrugs, resigned. Vanessa points to the nursery's largest wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wall is going to need something.  Maybe we could put our first family  picture there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stares at the wall, looking lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Leah are walking through the mall, looking bored Juno is wearing one of Mac's giant hockey jerseys in lieu actual maternity wear. Leah gnaws on a giant cinnamon pre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum. This pretzel tastes like a  friggin' donut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share the love, Tits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wrestles Leah for the pretzel. Onlookers stare at the appalled, as Leah puts Juno in a half-Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to eavesdroppers) She's assaulting me! She's denying  me fresh-baked goodness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah claps a hand over Juno's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) Hly shht!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno drags Leah behind a pillar and peers out from behind it. They're watching a group of well-heeled women and the children shopping en masse. One of the women is pushing a toddler in an ultramodern stroller. And one of the women VANESSA, looking vaguely detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) That's her. That's Vanessa Loring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the Penny Saver Lorings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! She's pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound shocked or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought she'd look really old  in real life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women gather near a play area, sip Frapps and loudly  discuss their outfits for an upcoming party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was like, "No offense, sweetie,  but nobody looks good in gauchos."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially not with her build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking the women,  Peanuts-style) Wah-wah-waaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the little girls in the group tugs at Vanessa's sl Vanessa happily follows the little girl over to their pla area and begins to play energetically with her. Juno watches intently, but Leah just snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna steal that kid for her  collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch Vanessa for a few more moments. The other kids wander over toward the play area while their mothers igno them. Vanessa continues to entertain the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo-ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah stands up. Juno lingers for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah and Juno approach the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a huge cookie. And like, a  lamb kebob. Simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Spermy. Must you always feed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens, revealing... Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno tries her best to look enthused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hi Vanessa! What brings you to  the mall today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, you know, shopping with my  girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno glares at Leah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please excuse Leah. She's mentally  challenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. So... how are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy? Oh, you mean like, physically.  I'm good. Look, I have a snooze button  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts her shirt and presses her popped-out NAVEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa is admiring the belly, when Juno grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's moshing all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains) It's kicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa nods in understanding then begins summoning the  courage for an unusual request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Juno, can I -- Can I touch it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Everyone at school  is always grabbing at my belly. I'm  like a legend. They call me the  Cautionary Whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Vanessa's hand and plants it on her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa moves her hand, wanting desperately to feel the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not moving for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says this as though it's an admission of failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you should try talking to it.  They can apparently hear speech in  there, even though it sounds all ten  thousands leagues under the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa kneels down next to the swell of Juno's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Hi, baby. It's me. My name is  Vanessa. I can't wait to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah gives a look to Juno as if she's about to barf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me sweet angel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa looks like she's giving up hope. Then suddenly,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God -- It moved! I felt it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! It's magical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno smiles at Vanessa in awe of her genuine affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are covered in muddy, slushy snow. The mud is instantly TRAMPLED underfoot by the collective feet of th Dancing Elk Track Team on their morning run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren cuts the top three inches off a pair of Juno's jeans Then, using a sewing machine, begins attaching an elastic waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're behind that same WAISTBAND, as Juno walks through t students. Now, people seem to part the waters for the bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark has the Les Paul on his lap as he stares at the boar of an awful commercial. CU - THE SCRIPT (storyboards). A kitchen scene with a kid eating a new breakfast product called -- BRUNCH BOWLZ. Annoyed and out of ideas, Mark begins an impromptu song..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IF YOU'RE TIRED OF BREAKFAST  BUT NOT HUNGRY FOR LUNCH,  MICROWAVE YOURSELF  A HEALTHY BOWL OF BRUNCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark drops his head, dejected. Then, the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I've been spending a lot of time  listening to that weird CD you made  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark instantly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? What's the verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of like it. I mean, it's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you're used to the raw  power of Iggy and the Stooges,  everything else sounds kind of  precious by comparison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine you have a collection of  punk chestnuts to prove your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it your musical education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying to see what you've got to  teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, stop surfing porn and get back  to work. Just wanted to say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go learn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark hangs up. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on Juno's tray sliding along, picking up an odd combo pregnant food. Pull up to find Juno and Leah walking their trays to a ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're getting huge. How many  months has it been now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost eight. You wouldn't believe  how weird I look naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish my funbags would get bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, you don't. I actually have  to wear a bra now. And I have to rub  this nasty cocoa butter stuff all  over myself or my skin could get  stretched too far and explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Leah are sitting inside an emptied awards case o the wall, eating their lunch. Juno notices that the other kids in the cafeteria can't h but glance her way. Some look derisive, others are amused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, why is everyone always staring  at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you are kind of... convex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She illustrates by making a rounded gesture near her stom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, someone's been actually doing  her geometry homework for once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice. Keith's been  grading me really hard lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not refer to Mr. Conyers  as "Keith," okay? My barf reflex is  already heightened these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eww, he's all beardy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see KEITH the teacher talking to some science kids in background. He has a Wild America beard. He lifts a cup o coffee to his lips and slurps lustily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear Bleek is going to prom  with Katrina De Voort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina? Pfft, no way. He doesn't  like Katrina. It must be a pity date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) He asked her. I heard they were going  to Benihana, then the prom, then to  Vijay's parents' cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker told me Katrina's whole house  reeks of soup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it totally does. I was there for  her birthday about four years ago  and it was like Lipton Landing. But  you know, boys have endured worse  things for nookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way in hell they're having  sex or even holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure about that. He  did it with you. He's a man now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Bleek trusted me. We're  best friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you jealous? I thought you said  you didn't care what he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not jealous, and I don't care. I  just know he doesn't like Katrina  and I don't think he should toy with  her emotions like that. She seems so  nice and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Juno, I'm really convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prom is for wenises, anyway. Once  you're old enough to go, it's not  cool anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker retrieves a book from his open locker. Juno march up to him, belly leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you honestly and truly going to  prom with Katrina De Voort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, hi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leah just told me you were going  with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did ask her if she wanted to  go. A bunch of us from the team are  going to Benihana, then the prom,  then Vijay's parents' cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno is clearly AFFRONTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly) We're getting a stretch limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom must be really glad you're  not taking me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad. Why are you mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad. I'm in a fucking great  mood. Despite the fact that I'm  trapped in a fat suit I can't take  off, despite the fact that everyone  is making fun of me behind my back,  despite the fact that your little  girlfriend gave me the stinkeye in  art class yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina's not my girlfriend! And I  doubt she was actually giving you  the stinkeye. She just looks like  that all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIRL strides past (obviously KATRINA) with a sour look  aimed squarely at Juno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Have fun at the prom with  Soupy Sales. I'm sure I can think of  something way more cool to do that  night. Like I could pumice my feet,  or go to Bren's dumb Unitarian church,  or get hit by a ten-ton truck full  of hot garbage juice. All those things  would be exponentially cooler than  going to the prom with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk away. Bleeker takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being really immature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning around) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker BRACES himself and pushes up his lab goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how our thing works! I  hurl the accusations and you talk me  down, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time. You don't have any  reason to be mad at me. You broke my  heart. I should be royally ticked at  you, man. I should be really cheesed  off. I shouldn't want to talk to you  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because I got bored and had sex  with you one day, and then I didn't,  like, marry you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'd marry you! You would be the  meanest wife of all time. And anyway,  I know you weren't bored that day  because there was a lot of stuff on  TV. The Blair Witch Project was on  Starz, and you were like, "Oh, I  want to watch this, but we should  make out instead. La la la."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Bleek. Take Katrina the  Douche Packer to the prom. I'm sure  you guys will have a really bitchin'  time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for a  comeback) Yeah, well... I still have your  underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have your virginity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around,  panicked) Oh my God, SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Are you ashamed that we did  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least you don't have to walk  around with the evidence under your  sweater. I'm a planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno picks up her BACKPACK dejectedly and slides it over shoulder. She's about to walk away, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, let me take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be carrying that heavy  bag. I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's fine. What's another ten  pounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, wipes TEARS off her cheek (making sure one sees) and continues down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno climbs ungracefully into the van. She starts the eng then pauses to dig through her backpack for something. Sh produces a brush and begins brushing her hair in the rear mirror, examining herself self-consciously. She puts on s Dr. Pepper Lip Smacker and backs out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is seated at the computer, surfing a horror movie  website. He has the blank expression of a bored obsessive The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark opens the door. Juno stands there, looking radiantly knocked-up. She holds a stack of CDs. Mark breaks into a  grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That shirt is working hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furtive) Is Vanessa here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. We're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Juno smile conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I have something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for Juno to follow him into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lorings' basement is dank, cluttered unfinished and  unattractive, much like Paulie Bleeker's. Mark pulls a ch to illuminate a bare bulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mark! Is this the baby's room?  It's beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hilarious. No, I just keep all of my  old comics down here, and I want to  show you one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, you're one of those guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna like this, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark RUMMAGES through a cardboard box in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extracting a bagged  COMIC from the box) Here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows the COMIC to Juno. It's called "Most Fruitful Yu It depicts a pregnant JAPANESE GIRL kicking ass and takin names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Most Fruitful Yuki"? What is... Oh  my god, she's a pregnant superhero!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that great? I got it when I  was in Japan with my band. She reminds  me of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno examines the comic. "Most Fruitful Yuki" does resemb her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I actually feel like less of a  fat dork now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most Fruitful Yuki is bad ass, man.  You should be proud to be the same  condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a KARATE KICK in Mark's direction with a KEE-Y Juno is sincerely pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about some tunes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a battered portable CD player in the corner. Juno kneels down and pops in one of the discs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this first one is kinda slow.  But it's Mott the Hoople so it's  still totally rad and hardcore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno puts in the CD and "All The Young Dudes" fills the r Mark Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually know this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this song's older than me, if  you can believe that. I danced to it  at my senior prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's almost interesting, Mark. Who  did you dance with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Cynthia Vogel and she  was a good dance partner. Even let  me put my hands on her butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I can just picture you slow  dancing like a dork!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mockingly places her hands on Mark's waist and moves  back and forth stiffly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I put my hands on your waist.  Then you put your arms around my  neck. That's how we did it in '88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark puts his hands on what remains of Juno's waist. She  drapes her arms around his neck self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never been to a dance, have  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually defensive) Only squares and nerds go to dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SWAY slowly to the music. Juno's belly bumps up agai Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like there's something between  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Juno rests her head on Mark's chest. They dance in silenc for a few moments, then stop moving. Mark pulls Juno as c as he possibly can, given her expanding girth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet at first) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just not working out, but I'm  getting my own place in the city...  and I've got it all planned out.  It's something I've wanted to do for  a long time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, you definitely cannot do  that, Mark. That's a big, fat sack  of no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what we agreed on. You  guys have to take care of... this!  You are the chosen custodians of the  big-ass bump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GESTURES wildly to her belly. Suddenly, something mat to her far more than the approval of an older guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you'd be cool if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I want you guys to adopt the Buglet.  I wanted everything to be perfect.  Not shitty and broken like everyone  else's family. Listen, once I have  the baby, Vanessa is going to finally  be happy, and everything will be all  right. Believe me on this one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby is not going to fix everything.  Besides, I don't know if I'm ready  to be a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) But you're old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... How do you think of me, Juno?  Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just liked being  your friend. I sort of liked becoming  furniture in your weird life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... (he gestures to the  dank surrounding  room) ...this is what my life has become.  Stuff in boxes. Stuff underground.  Is that so appealing to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess... Is this my fault?  Is Vanessa mad at you because of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point. We're just not  in love anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but didn't you love Vanessa  when you married her? If you love  someone once, you can love them again,  I know it. My friend Leah has gone  out with the same guy, like, four  times. You're just not trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark suddenly sees Juno for what she is -- a teenage girl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm such an idiot. I can't believe  what an idiot I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces over to the wall and KICKS it softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't get a divorce! God,  Mark, just do me a solid and stay  with your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're so young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I'm sixteen. I'm old  enough to tell when people are acting  like total a-holes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno turns to leave, then shoots one furious look back at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and by the way, I bought another  Sonic Youth album and it's the worst  thing I've ever heard! It's just  noise, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts up the stairs, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno reaches the top of the stairs and scrambles toward t front door, only to be intercepted by Vanessa, who's retu home from work, carrying her briefcase and a freshly purc NURSING PILLOW. They nearly collide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious from Juno's tears and flushed face that she' lying. Vanessa instantly goes pale with fear, but she tri her hardest to seem serene and "together" in front of Jun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be  calm) Mark? Why is Juno crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crying. I'm allergic to fine  home furnishings. See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno, what's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hormonal. Right, June? It's  just part of the whole process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno looks totally betrayed. She doesn't respond. Vanessa looks at Juno's expression and knows Mark is lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything... I just...  I've just been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (you've been thinking?) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thinking if this is really the  right thing for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you referring to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows exactly to what he's referring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been just wondering if we're,  you know, ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we're ready. We've taken  all the classes. The nursery. The  books --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we're prepared. I just don't  know if... I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno's face continues to fall. Vanessa notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Juno) Juno, don't worry about this. He  just has cold feet. That's how boys  are. The books all say the same thing.  A woman becomes a mother when she  gets pregnant. A man becomes a father  when he sees his baby. He's going to  get there. He'll get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno ain't buying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mark) Why don't we let Juno go home and we  can discuss this later on, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all just happened so fast. We put  that ad in the paper. I thought it  would take months if, you know, ever  and then -- boom -- Two weeks later,  she's in our living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) She answered our prayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores the comment) Ever since, it's just been like a  ticking clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Vanessa. Juno looks offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long hideous beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just feels a little like bad  timing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another hideous beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would be a good time for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There's just things I  still want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? Be a rock star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mock me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa sighs. It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to do something that's  never going to happen. And you know  what? Your shirt is stupid. Grow up.  If I have to wait for you to become  Kurt Cobain, I'm never going to be a  mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa looks defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said I'd be a great father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the front door closing. Vanessa and Mark look ove and notice that Juno has escaped the conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno runs up to her car sobbing. She struggles with the k but finally makes it into the Previa and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Previa slides off the road and comes to a stop on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno buckles over the steering wheel, crying, unwinding f the first time since she became pregnant. After a beat, she begins to gather herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker is sitting next to his bed, noodling on the guita He's playing a theme that we will soon recognise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno lays on the hood of her Previa, contemplating her fu We push in close... when she gets an idea. She hops off the hood and scurries into the Previa where finds a crumpled up Jiffy Lube receipt. She unfolds it an pulls out a pen, ready to write something... a note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet after the storm. Inside, we see Vanessa sittin alone at her perfect dining room table, drinking a glass wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa takes a sip and continues to let the days events  sink in. After a beat, Mark comes down the stairs to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Gerta Rauss. She says she  can represent both of us. They call  it "collaborative divorce." It's  apparently all the rage right now.  And it's easy because we don't have  children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. Thanks for making the  call, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark nods and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're actually, finally doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you found a place to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly teasing) Aren't you the cool guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They STARE at the wall, speechless and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted a baby so bad. So bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She buries her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a LOUD KNOCK on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark opens the door. There's a folded piece of paper sitt on the doormat. He squints and sees Juno pulling away in van. Mark carefully unfolds the piece of paper -- it takes a m because of Juno's proficiency in "teen girl origami." He  holds it up. We can see there's WRITING on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a bill from Jiffy-Lube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa takes the note from his hand and turns it over,  examining it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno parks her car and walks up to her house. A porch lig been left on for her, and the place looks cozy and inviti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never realize how much I like being  home unless I've been somewhere really  different for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks a CROCUS from the unkempt garden near the porch and sniffs it. She lifts her shirt and tickles her belly  with it. Then she tucks the flower into her unkempt hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac is alone at the kitchen table going over the family  finances while drinking one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, big puffy version of Junebug.  Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dealing with stuff way beyond my  maturity level. Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bren took Liberty Bell to her tot  ice skating class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tot ice skating? Tots can't ice skate.  Liberty Bell's still getting the  hang of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but you know Bren. She dreams  big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a little morose, honey.  What's eating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm losing my faith in humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you can narrow it down for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I wonder sometimes if people  ever stay together for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like couples?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like people in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having boy trouble? I gotta  be honest; I don't much approve of  you dating in your condition,  'cause... well, that's kind of messed  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's kind of skanky. Isn't  that what you girls call it? Skanky?  Skeevy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (persisting) Tore up from the floor up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's not about that. I just  need to know that it's possible for  two people to stay happy together  forever. Or at least for a few years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy, that's for sure. Now,  I may not have the best track record  in the world, but I have been with  your stepmother for ten years now,  and I'm proud to say that we're very  happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my opinion, the best thing you  can do is to find a person who loves  you for exactly what you are. Good  mood, bad mood, ugly, pretty,  handsome, what have you, the right  person will still think that the sun  shines out your ass. That's the kind  of person that's worth sticking with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of REALIZATION crosses Juno's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course. Your old D-A-D! You  know I'll always be there to love  and support you, no matter what kind  of pickle you're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods toward her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno laughs and hugs her father, planting a smooch on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go out somewhere for just  a little while. I don't have any  homework, and I swear I'll be back  by ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She salutes and dashes out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking about me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push in over Bleeker sleeping in his car-bed towards t window. We look out onto the lawn to find Juno and Leah  running back to the Previa, hopping in, and screeching of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker steps out of the house for his usual early-mornin run. He looks down to see a message scrawled in chalk on stoop: "BLEEKER -- CHECK THE MAIL." He walks down to the end of the driveway and opens the la on the mailbox. At least one hundred containers of ORANGE TIC TACS come  pouring out in an colorful deluge. They spill out onto th driveway. Bleeker smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno waddles toward the field. The guys on the track team ridiculously arrayed as usual, are doing hurdler stretche They stare at her quizzically. Bleeker spots Juno approac and jogs up to the chainlink fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you put like a hundred things of  Tic Tacs in my mailbox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushes) Because they're your fave. And you  can never have too much of your  favorite one-calorie breath mint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... thanks. I think I'm pretty  much set until college on the Tic  Tac front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've been thinking. I'm  really sorry I was such a huge bitch  to you. You didn't deserve that. You  never deserve any of the poo I unload  on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, I think I'm in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you mean as friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, for real. I think you are the  coolest person I've ever met. And  you don't even have to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try really hard, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're naturally smart. You always  think of the funniest things to do.  Remember when you passed me that  postcard during Spanish class, and  it was addressed like, "Junebug  MacGuff, Row 4, Third Seat From the  Blackboard"? And it said, "I'm having  fun in Barcelona -- wish you were  here"? That was hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just bored. I only think school  is awesome like, 80% of the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, you're the only person who  doesn't stare at my stomach all the  fucking time. You actually look at  my face. And every time I look at  you, the baby starts kicking me super  hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno presses Bleeker's hand against her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wizard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's because my heart starts  pounding when I see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically, I'm completely smitten  with you, and I don't care if I'm  making an ass out of myself right  now, because you've seen me make an  ass out of myself a million times,  and you still want to be my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. You're the best friend  I've ever had, even when you're being  kind of evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I need from you. That's  more than I could ever ask for. You're  just golden, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we make out now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker and Juno KISS, oblivious to the gawking track tea guys in the background. In the distance, near the school entrance, we see STEVE  RENDAZO (the kid who always TORMENTS Juno) regarding the  makeout session with a sad, envious expression. LEAH passes by, does a double take, then hurries up to th fence, rolling her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) You know, you can go into early labor  sucking face like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno gives her the FINGER, not breaking the clinch with  Bleeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno is lying on her back on the bed, staring at the ceil She's more pregnant than we've ever seen her. She revs a  Matchbox car against the slope of her belly and lets it r Juno suddenly sits up, looking thoroughly freaked. She pa her lap frantically and jumps off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac looks up from the lure he's working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either I just pissed my pants or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thundercats are go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, Bren and Liberty Bell rush out of the house. They pi into the Previa at breakneck speed. Juno waddles behind t protesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Juno wearing a puffy surgical cap. She's being push down the hospital corridor in a wheelchair. She bursts in giggles. Pull back to reveal her that Leah is pushing her rather aggressively. Leah jokingly steers the wheelchair  into a wall. Juno feigns whiplash. Bren appears behind them and orders Juno out of the  wheelchair, exasperated. She pulls off Juno's surgical ca Leah and Juno snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Juno is in a BIRTHING SUITE at the hospital, pacin impatiently, bent over in obvious discomfort. She's weari her Chuck Taylors and knee socks with her hospital gown.  Leah and Bren stand nearby. Juno doubles over in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Ow, ow, fuckity-ow. Bren, when do I  get that Spinal Tap thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a spinal block, and you  can't have it yet, honey. The doctor  said you're not dilated enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I have to wait for it to  get even worse? Why can't they just  give it to me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, honey, doctors are sadists who  like to play God and watch lesser  people scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno lets out a genuine shriek of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking her watch) Shit. (To the doctor) Hey, can we give my kid the damn  spinal tap already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really didn't hurt that bad having  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Juno in the process of delivery, from her POV. Lea holds one of Juno's feet and Bren holds the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best part was when I peed on  Leah during labor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Leah holding Juno's FOOT, which is shaking. Leah's shirt is soaked. She rolls her eyes and mouths "Fuck you" Juno. Juno's raised MIDDLE FINGER enters the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, out of nowhere, there it  was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor reveals JUNO'S BABY BOY above the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno looks at the baby in awe, then her eyes begin to  flutter... and she passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie Bleeker is running as fast as his legs can carry h on the Dancing Elk track. There's a very sparse crowd in bleachers. As Paulie approaches the tape, his envious tea Vijay looks on. Bleeker's mom is seated near Vijay, holdi a video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided to not call Bleeker to  tell him that I was having the baby.  He had a big meet against Manteno  and I didn't want him to get all  worried about me and choke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie breaks the tape, winning the race. The fifteen or people in attendance cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiringly) His legs are as swift as his seed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker pants at the finish line, dripping with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P. Bleeker has just broken a district  record in the 400.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker looks out at the BLEACHERS, scanning them for Jun She's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he figured it out anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleek takes off RUNNING toward the parking lot without  stopping to explain. His mother stands up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE reaches into one of the maternity ward bassinets gently lifts up a swaddled newborn baby. The nurse turns and addresses an unseen spectator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to meet your son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal she's speaking to VANESSA, who stands paralyzed, several feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) You are the adoptive mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healthy kid, too. Didn't waste any  time getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa reaches out for the baby and gingerly accepts him her eyes. She spends a few moments just looking at him. She feels someone watching her, then looks up to see a Br leaning against the doorway. Vanessa blinks away her tears self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Like a mom. Scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanessa laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno is curled up on her bed in the birthing room. The bi is obviously over; there's that air of stillness and  accomplishment, a task completed. The doctors have cleare out. Mac sits in a chair next to the bed, looking like he not sure what to say. He holds up a deck of Playing cards as if to initiate a g but Juno gently pushes his hand away. Their eyes meet. Hi expression is helpless, hers is utterly drained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday, you'll be back here, honey.  On your terms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno nods and swallows. Over Mac's shoulder, a silhouette appears in the doorway. It's Bleeker in his track uniform. Juno sees him and bursts into sudden, ragged sobs. Mac gl at her, alarmed. Paulie moves toward the bed. Mac clears throat, gets up and leaves the room. Paulie climbs onto the hospital bed and carefully puts hi arm around Juno. She leans into him, letting herself go f the first time in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno lies on the bed. She looks rested and relaxed compar to her earlier crying jag, but her face is still pink and swollen. Bleeker is curled up next to her, still in his t uniform and spikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker decided he didn't want to  see the baby. Neither did I, really.  He didn't feel like ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Vanessa leaning over the bassinet, unable to take eyes off the baby, touching it's hair reverently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was always hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nursery is perfectly decorated in Vanessa's immaculat taste. Nothing looks as though it's been touched. We see antique ROCKING CHAIR sitting empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ended with a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan past the wall Vanessa had said "needed something." There's a framed note on the wall. It looks like it was  handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. We see that says: "Vanessa -- If you're still in, I'm still in. Juno. We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom. see her lying in bed with a burp cloth draped over her  shoulder, feeding the baby. For the first time ever, Vane looks disorganized, unshowered -- and incredibly happy. T are formula bottles on the bedside table and a bassinet p close to the bed. Obviously, she hasn't been away from th baby for a single moment. The baby reaches up and grabs Vanessa's thumb. Vanessa gl with an expression of pure bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sparkling summer afternoon. Juno wheels her bicycl out of the detached garage. She waves goodbye to Bren, wh is playing in the yard with two WEIMARANERS. She looks al as happy with her dogs as VANESSA looked with her baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno rides her bike aggressively down the street. Her gui is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag. She's obviously pregnant anymore. She looks happy, but older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As boyfriends go, Paulie Bleeker is  totally boss. He is the cheese to my  macaroni. I know people are supposed  to fall in love before they reproduce,  but normalcy's not really our style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she tears recklessly down the street on her bikes, she passes the Dancing Elk TRACK TEAM, still running in  outrageously skimpy shorts and bandanas. Juno RIDES up to a garage where Bleeker is sitting, tunin his guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno bikes up to find Bleeker sitting on the stoop. She s and takes out her guitar. She sits across from Bleeker an pulls the pick out of the strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleeker nods. Juno begins strumming her guitar and playing "Anyone Else But You," by the Moldy Peaches. Bleeker joins in. At firs their playing is discordant, but suddenly it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a part time lover and a  fulltime friend. The monkey on your  back is the latest trend. I don't  see what anyone can see, in anyone  else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is the church and here is the  steeple. We sure are cute for two  ugly people. I don't see what anyone  can see, in anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both have shiny happy fits of  rage. You want more fans, I want  more stage. I don't see what anyone  can see, in anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are always trying to keep it  real. I'm in love with how you feel.  I don't see what anyone can see, in  anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kiss you on the brain in the shadow  of a train. I kiss you all starryeyed,  my body's swinging from side to side.  I don't see what anyone can see, in  anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pebbles forgive me, the trees  forgive me. So why can't you forgive  me? I don't see what anyone can see,  in anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du du du du du du dudu. Du du du du  du du dudu. I don't see what anyone  can see, in anyone else but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Bleeker exchange glances as they play. They smile ambiguously. Juno leans over and kisses Bleeker on the ch Pull out to reveal the surrounding green suburb buzzing w life and summer activity.
